fields.summary: Import more than 100 issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-13].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

You should be able to automatically synchronise the order that Stories are scheduled in JIRA Portfolio with the Backlog view on a JIRA Agile board.
fields.summary: Sync backlog order with JIRA Agile
Automatic creation of issuetype Initiative
Cost per Story

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-10].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

At the moment, sprints scheduled in Portfolio and Agile aren't aligned. Options to keep them synchronised (manually or automatically) would allow the users to fully utilise both add-ons and increase the clarity with regard to data displayed in different parts of JIRA.
fields.summary: Keep Sprints in sync with JIRA Agile
Filters should apply to options available in dropdowns
Releases as Fix Versions
Dependencies as Issue Links
Issues in Iniative issue link
Team commitment
Support relative time estimations
A enterprise solution should not load all LDAP groups because it is incredibly slow.
Support JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The IQL query sent by A4J assumes that "Name" is always the label attribute of Insight object types. It fails to account for the changing of an object type's label to any other text attribute or the renaming of the default "Name" attribute. Any object type which does not use "Name" as the label will be excluded from A4J results.

Using a rule action that excludes all Insight values that use another name as the label is a strong limitation of the feature.
h3. Suggestion

A4J version 7.2.3 introduced 'query as you type ' in insight object dropdown, so lack of pagination was mitigated by narrowing the results. Pagination through results should help.
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Insight values not found - Pagination is expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue deleted trigger in automation rule always fails with an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule for the "issue deleted" trigger.
 # now try to delete any issue within the scope of the automation rule.
 # The automation rule fails and now, check the Audit log of the rule.

h3. Expected Results

The automation rule should be successful

h3. Actual Results

The Automation rule fails with the following error:
{code}
Issue event
Unexpected error executing rule:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Could not resolve issue with key: TEST-13
{code}

h3. Workaround


Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue deleted trigger in automation rule always fails with an error.

fields.description:
As an automation rule writer
I want the "filter rules" performance to be faster
So I can quickly find the rules I need to maintain and not waste time.

 

Current conditions:

With a project that has over 200 rules, the "filter rules" function is quite slow.  In fact, when typing in search criteria, the filter field starts to lose entered search characters during the repaint of the screen.  Each character...must...be...entered...one...at...a...time...slowly...in order for the search to keep up and not lose information.

This performance issue is even worse when deleting characters, as the search cannot keep up with deletion, and so ignores any Backspace key presses.  The only work-arounds are:
 * to try to delete all characters from the field and start over, or
 * to ignore the search and save your own index of rules in a separate document with links directly to the rules!

This symptom has been made worse lately due to the performance incidents for Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: please improve "filter rules" performance in the rules list / manager

fields.description:
As an automation rule writer
I want to test if a list contains a value within smart value/conditional filtering
So specific items within a source list can be processed

Acceptance criteria:
 * the contains() function is added for list processing
 * contains() has a parameter for the value to find
 * when the value is found the result is true, and is false (null) otherwise
 * when the tested list is null, the result of contains() is always false (null)
 * Bonus: the parameter can optionally be a list of values to test; leading to an intersection test of the sets of the source list and parameter

Usage scenario:

Lists can be examined using regular expression matches or conditional filtering.  Yet when the source list contains child lists, it is not easily testable for the contents of that child list.  The values can be extracted and tested using regular expression matches, but then the parent object is not available: only the matching values.  Think of a Lookup Issues result of issues, containing a list of sprint values in each.  One possible work-around today is to try to use the JQL and repeated calls to Lookup Issues.  Having the ability to perform contains() tests on the child lists enables using just one Lookup Issues call, followed by filtering the data as needed.
fields.summary: add contains function for conditional/filtering of smart value lists

fields.description:
It would be great to have the option to add custom Automation rules to the Automation Library.
h2. Why/Benefits?
 * It would help speed up Project provisioning for Project Admins (no need to re-create rules)
 * It would allow a more experienced "automation admin" to create rules securely and share them with their team
 * Project admins don't need to know the internals of other projects to find useful automation rules

h2. Current situation
 * It's not possible to add custom rules to the Automation Library

h2. Suggested solution
 * System/Project admins create an Automation Rule and decide it could be useful for other projects
 * Admins add this rule to the Library
 * Other Project admins can choose and add custom rules from the *Library* to their projects

h2. Possible workarounds?
 * [See this community response|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Convert-global-automation-rules-to-project-level/qaq-p/1323560#M69028]
fields.summary: Ability to add custom Automation Rules to the Automation Library

fields.description:
As an automation rule writer
I want the ability to sort a smart value list
So that I can access specific values from the list in my desired ordering

Acceptance criteria:
 * add a new function, sort() to manage smart value list items
 * accepts an attribute of the list to sort the list
 ** {{Example: {{{{{}issue.fixVersions.sort(name){}}}}}}}
 * accepts an optional parameter to control ascending or descending sorts, with a default value of ASC
 ** {{Example: {{{{{}issue.fixVersions.sort(name, "DESC"){}}}}}}}
 * Bonus feature: multiple criteria can be specified for the sort order
 ** {{Example: {{{{{}issue.fixVersions.sort(releaseDate, "DESC", name, "ASC"){}}}}}}}
 * Bonus feature: another smart value can be provided to describe the sort criteria
 ** {{Example:}}
 *** created variable of varSort = "name, 'DESC'" 
 *** {{ {{{{{}issue.fixVersions.sort(varSort){}}}}}}}

 

Business case:

Using the min() and max() functions, it is possible to capture a specific value from a list (such as by dates), and then use that in a created variable with list filtering to extract a desired list value(s).  However I do not believe there is a way to return the entire list in a desired order.  A sort() function could simplify rules which need to identify all attributes of a smart value list item, given the first, last, etc. conditions for a particular sort ordering.
fields.summary: add ability to sort a smart value list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Transition issue action by "Selecting a specific transition" option causes the page to go unresponsive (or respond very slow) in an instance with a lot of workflows.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an instance with a bunch of workflows (real time customer environments can have 10s of workflows)
 # Try creating a project automation rule as below selecting the  "Selecting a specific transition" radio button:
 # Click on "Select a transition" dropdown:
!2021-12-16_18-07-23.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Only the transitions available in context of the issue type(s) associated workflow(s) are loaded

h3. Actual Results
It loads all workflows across the entire instance causing either the drop down options load slow or the page to go unresponsive


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Transition issue action by "Selecting a specific transition" option causes the page to go unresponsive (or respond very slow) in an instance with a lot of workflows

fields.description:
Sometimes customers implement multiple automation rules which can be conflicting with each other.

This feature request is to allow to add a condition to an automation rule to check whether another rule is already running (in progress) and not execute the rule if it is.
fields.summary: Create a condition (dependency) not to run a rule when another rule is already running

fields.description:
h3. Issue

The automation module that comes out-of-the-box in Jira Service Management (JSM) projects has an action that allows request to be automatically approved or declined based on some condition, as explained in [Auto-approve requests|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/setting-up-approvals-939926369.html#Settingupapprovals-Auto-approverequests].

An example of automation rule that can be configured using the JSM automation feature is illustrated in the screenshot below:
 !JSD_Automation.png|thumbnail! 

When using instead the automation module from the add-on [Automation from Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira-data-center-and-server?tab=overview], it is unfortunately possible to auto-approve requests. When configuring an automation rule that will automatically transition a request from the status "Waiting for Approval" using the "Approved" transition, this rule will fail with the following error:
{code}
No matching transitions could be found for issues (with current status):
{code}
 !A4J_AutomationRule.png|thumbnail! 
 !A4J_AutomationAuditLog.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Add a new action to Automation for Jira to allow requests to be automatically approved or declined.
fields.summary: Add the ability to automatically approve or decline requests using a rule from Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no notification sent to the Rule owner when the rule is throttled.
h3. Suggestion

If a throttled rule appears a notification should be sent to the Rule Owner.
h3. Workaround

You can count on the [*Performance insights*|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/view-performance-insights/] feature inside Automation. This gives an overall view of all rules. Through this, you're able to check which ones have got throttled on the last hour/day/week/month.
fields.summary: Notification when an automaton rule is throttled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no option to remove/delete all the rules from the UI.
h3. Suggestion

There should be an option to "Remove All Rules" from the UI or bulk remove multiple rules by selecting the corresponding checkboxes.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Remove All Rules Option

fields.description:
Can we have a smart value to get the *branch details* (ie, branch name) ** in an {*}individual commit{*}?

These are some [smart values|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-development/#Smartvalues-development-repository] that Jira supports for the source code management tool currently.

Currently we can get the smart values like {{{{{}branch.name{}}}}} and {{{{{}commit.message{}}}}} but it's not possible to get the *branch details* in an {*}individual commit{*}. For example, something like {{{{{}commit.branch.name{}}}}} to get the branch name in the commit will be ideal.
fields.summary: Provide a smart value to get the branch name in an individual commit

fields.description:
When having this step in any Automation, it is sending emails to the assignee informing that the ticket has change the status, which is not always required.

It would be nice to have a checkbox where you can choose if those emails should be sent or not. Exactly as the step called "Edit Issue" has and says "This rule should send emails. Rule actor must be an admin or project admin"
fields.summary: Transition Issue - Have a check not to send emails if necessary

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we set the "SLA threshold breached" trigger to "will breach in the next 5 Days," it will actually fire five (5) days after the SLA starts counting down, rather than five days until the SLA is breached.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM project
 # Create an automation using the "SLA threshold breached" trigger
 ## Use the default Time to Resolution SLA with the sample 9-5 calendar
 ## Select "will breach in the next" and set this to "5" and "days"
 ## Select any Action (e.g., send an email or add to the audit log)
 # Create an issue that falls under the selected SLA 
 
 # Note when the issue is due to breach and when the Action is triggered.

h3. Expected Results

The automation will be triggered five days _before_ the SLA is breached.
h3. Actual Results

The automation is triggered five days _after_ the SLA starts counting down.
h3. Workaround

It seems that using hours (e.g., 40 hours, assuming nine (9) hour workdays) gets past this limitation.
fields.summary: SLA threshold breached Trigger Misfires

fields.description:
Currently Automation has an action to send email, and it supports email addresses, user/group fields, groups and smart values (which are expected to contain email addresses) but does not yet support project roles. 

This request is to add support for project roles in this automation action.
fields.summary: Add the ability to send email to all members of a project role using Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Project Admin, if you try to configure a Project Automation Rule with an action to Create / Edit Issue, including an Insight CF - the Insight CF will not display any options.

You may be able to see optional objects if your User has the Jira Admin Global Permission (via Group Membership) - only after you start typing a search string in the Insight CF.
 Insight - any version

A4J - v.7.3.5
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in as an Insight Admin - (to avoid any possible Insight Role restrictions)
 # Configure an Insight Object Type with objects.
 # Configure an Insight CF to populate with this objectType
 (simple CF configuration: Select Schema, and a Filter Scope IQL: objectType = myOT)
 # Add the CF to your Project's screens
 # Configure an A4J Project Automation, with an Action to Create / Update an Issue containing an Insight CF - attempt to set a Value for the Insight CF

 - As a Jira Admin - start start typing a Search String (Object's Name) - see that a drop down is showing Objects to select from
 - Try to do the same, when logged in as a User who is an Insight Admin, and a Project Admin - but is NOT a Jira Admin

h3. Expected Results

Objects are showing in the Dropdown, available to be selected
h3. Actual Results

The CF continues to show loading... endlessly.
 The Browser's Log shows many calls with 405 error responses, querying GET instead of a POST for IQL
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

either add the User to the Jira Admin Global permission, or, use the "More Options" to in the Automation rule's action configuration - to set up a static Object Key in the JSON payload, so that the action will update the Insight CF accordingly (see details [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/insightapps/insight-with-jira-rest-api-1085180905.html])
fields.summary: Populating an Insight CF when configuring an A4J Rule's Action does not return Objects for some Users.

fields.description:
h4. Feature request
The Send Webhook action does not support authentication of any kind. 

While the "Headers" feature could be used to hack in authentication, it would be better to have a UI for this so that credentials could be stored and used securely for outbound webhooks.
fields.summary: Implement authentication for Send Webhook action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Send Email" action to a group of users having  >100 users will send emails to only 100 users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation rule with Send Email action to a group of users that contains more than 100 users (could be 200 to 300 users)
# publish the rule and wait for the rule to be executed

h3. Expected Results
The Automation rule should notify all users in the group i.e all 200 users

h3. Actual Results
The Audit log of the Automation rule shows that the rule was executed successfully but the rule only sends emails to 100 users and this is due to a hard limit in the Automation for Jira,  there is a hardcoded limit of 100 when getting users that are members of a group. So A4J will always cut the users in any group number to 100

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Send Email" action to a group of users having  >100 users will send emails to only 100 users

fields.description:
When using a version picker custom field with the Issue fields condition, I could like the following additional options in the Condition drop-down:
 * releasedVersions
 * unreleasedVersions

Often, I do not need to list specific fixVersions, but I do want to specify ALL Released fixVersions or ALL Unreleased fixVersions.

 

The workaround is to use a JQL condition which causes complaining comments in the audit logs since A4J wants us to use Issue field conditions as much as possible.

"Versionfield in unreleasedVersions()"
fields.summary: Add released/unreleased versions to Issue fields condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to set "Next unreleased version" as a *Fix Version/s* for newly created issues , a4j ignores the field modification and creates the issue without any fix version
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add unreleased version to a project from project settings - Versions
 # create an automation rule that runs on a schedule  !image-2021-11-02-13-22-32-474.png|width=310,height=136!
 # Create a new task while setting the fix version to next unreleased version  !image-2021-11-02-13-23-39-197.png|width=370,height=197!
 # Allow the rule to run

h3. Expected Results

The created ticket have the next unreleased version set as a fix version.
h3. Actual Results

The value is not set and the fix version fied is empty

!image-2021-11-02-13-25-18-461.png|width=483,height=159!

!image-2021-11-02-13-25-41-827.png|width=470,height=213!
h3. Workaround

Create a second rule that runs on schedule with a JQL , and edit the fix version field manually 

!image-2021-11-02-13-30-23-551.png|width=421,height=220!
fields.summary: Setting unreleased version on a scheduled trigger does not set the value

fields.description:
Currently, Automation for Jira does not offer native support for the native custom field type - 'Project Picker (single project)'.

For this reason, if someone wants to use this field in automation, they are required to use [Advanced field editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/advanced-field-editing-993924663.html]. As this is a native field from Jira, A4J should provide support for it.
fields.summary: Add native support to Jira's CF type - Project Picker (single project)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

We'd like to have an Automation Rule function that executes and collects values of a calculated field, such as Age of a ticket without updating it. Currently, it's necessary to Edit the ticket to have the calculation being run, and that updates the age of the ticket, which is undesired.
fields.summary: Automation Rule to get value of Calculated field without Editing it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
any user with project admin privileges are able to rename/edit the labels created by different user

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a user named 'testuser' and grant them  project admin privileges on a project example 'TEST'
 # now login as testuser and go to TEST project > project settings > project automation > create label names 'created by testuser'
# create another user with name 'testuser1' and grant them project admin preveliges on a different project example: TESTDVCS
# now login as 'testuser1' go to TESTDVCS project > project settings > project automation > labels and click the label created by testuser i.e 'created by testuser' and click on edit and edit the rule to a different name

h3. Expected Results
testuser1 shouldn't be able to edit the labels created by testuser

h3. Actual Results

any user with project admin permissions on the Jira instance is able to edit the labels
(i) please go through [Organize your rules with labels|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/organize-your-rules-with-labels-993924698.html] for more information

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: any user with project admin privileges are able to rename/edit the labels created by different user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using *Send Web Request* action with POST Issue Data not providing attachment information after 7.3.4 upgrade.

Tested with multiple Jira versions (8.13.5, 8.13.8, 8.15.0).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or update an issue to have an attachment.
 # Create a new rule with any trigger.
 # Create a new action of *Send web request.*
 # Add any value to the *Webhook URL* (such as "test")
 # Select HTTP method *POST* and webhook body of *Issue Data*.
 # Expand the *Validate your webhook configuration* and enter your issue key.
 # Click *Validate* and expand the Request > Payload area.

h3. Expected Results

For an issue with an attachment the following is expected:
{noformat}
    "attachment": [
      {
        "self": "http://localhost:48135/j8135/rest/api/2/attachment/10000",
        "id": 10000,
        "filename": "appreciation.pdf",
        "author": {
          "self": "http://localhost:48135/j8135/rest/api/2/user?username=admin",
          "name": "admin",
          "key": "JIRAUSER10000",
          "accountId": null,
          "emailAddress": "admin@atlassian.com",
          "avatarUrls": {
            "48x48": "https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/5c1526ade5aea60fda64479097670188?d=mm&s=48",
            "24x24": "https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/5c1526ade5aea60fda64479097670188?d=mm&s=24",
            "16x16": "https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/5c1526ade5aea60fda64479097670188?d=mm&s=16",
            "32x32": "https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/5c1526ade5aea60fda64479097670188?d=mm&s=32"
          },
          "displayName": "My Name",
          "active": true,
          "timeZone": "America/Sao_Paulo",
          "groups": null,
          "locale": null
        },
        "created": 1634933575491,
        "size": 800567,
        "mimeType": "application/pdf",
        "content": "http://localhost:48135/j8135/secure/attachment/10000/appreciation.pdf"
      } {noformat}
h3. Actual Results

The element "Attachment" is not present in the payload body.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

Note that while the issue is not present on 7.3.3 we do not recommend rolling back Automation for Jira at this point.
fields.summary: Send Web Request with POST Issue Data not providing attachment information

fields.description:
Currently, we are able to Edit the "*Resolution*" field to set some value but we are unable to clear the value of the "*Resolution*" field.

*Suggested Solution:*

It'd be good if we can clear the Resolution using Automation Rules or if we can set the value to '*None*'

*Workaround*:

We can achieve this using the post function as mentioned in this KB for 
 - [How to clear the resolution field when the issue is reopened|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-clear-the-resolution-field-when-the-issue-is-reopened-648381467.html]
fields.summary: Have an option to set the "Resolution" field to 'None' or clear the resolution using automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the *Link Issues* action only allows to link an issue to:
- the *Trigger Issue*
- or the *Most recently created issue*
 !Screenshot 2021-10-22 at 16.28.52.png|thumbnail! 

In some cases, customers might want to automatically link issues together based on some field value. Any example of use case if the following:
- if field A is updated to 5, 6 or 7 in Issue A
- then link Issue A to any other issue that contains the value 5 in the same custom field

h3. Suggestion

Improve the *Link Issues* action so that we can choose which issue(s) can be linked to the issue that triggered the automation rule.
fields.summary: Improvement of the "Link issues" action

fields.description: When a user triggers automated actions with conditions we need a mechanism to notify the user when the conditions are not met. I have a rule that requires all stories under an Epic to be in one of certain statuses. If that condition is not met it would be good to tell the user so they know the rule did not run and what needs to be done. Even better if it could list the specific failures but just a basic notification would be a huge improvement. How about instead of the misleading message that the rule ran successfully (yes, it ran successfully from a code perspective) the banner says "Rule XXX ran with some errors", or "Some conditions of rule XXX were not met"?
fields.summary: Notify user on failure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using smartvalues to retrieve time, we face the error "{{Failed to get value for now: \{\{now\}\}}}" when running the automation rule

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unable to reproduce so far what triggers the environment to reach this state.

When it is in this state, though, any rule with time smartvalues fail. For example, post a comment with {{\{\{now\}\}}}

h3. Expected Results
The rule runs successfully.

h3. Actual Results
We see in the rule log the message:
{code}Error rendering smart-values when executing this rule:
Failed to get value for now: {{now}} {code}

!image-2021-10-14-18-36-45-876.png! 

h3. Workaround

[Set the timezone in the JVM arguments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-set-the-timezone-for-the-java-environment-841187402.html]:
* Go to the setenv.sh file and add the parameter below:
{code}
-Duser.timezone=America/Denver
{code}
(i) There is a list of available timezones [here|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones].
* Restart Jira.
fields.summary: Using time related smartvalues such as {{now}} result in an error "Failed to get value "

fields.description:
Currently, as mentioned in [our documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/run-rules-as-another-user/], it says the following:
 * *Project admins vs global admins*: Project admins can only choose themselves or the _Automation for Jira_ user as the rule actor. Global admins can select anyone to be the rule actor.

However, in Jira server/datacenter it's not working as mentioned in the documentation, the project admin can also change to any user as an Actor of the Automation rule.
fields.summary: Automation rule actor can be changed to any user by project admin in jira

fields.description:
Would be great if when scrolling down the Add component div can scroll together with the screen.

This is because I have very long automation rules with many if/else if so it is a pain to scroll up and down everytime I add a new component to the bottom of the rule.

Thank you!

!image-2021-10-06-11-35-04-877.png|width=865,height=611!
fields.summary: Sticky div for add component

fields.description:
Convoluted if-elseif-elseif-...-else statements are difficult to reason about.

Many languages provide an ability to "return" out of an imperative flow early, when certain base cases eliminate the need to proceed down the main flow (AKA "short-circuit" programming, e.g., for "guard clauses").

Please provide a rule action "Return" that can be used within if-statements.
fields.summary: Add "Return" action for rules to enable short-circuit programming

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, it is not possible to add the organization as recipient in the send email action. This request was copied from [https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-921] to add this feature.
h3. Workaround

A workaround was suggested in [this community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Automation-questions/How-to-use-organization-members-as-email-recipients/qaq-p/1781910] to create a group to be kept synced with the organization and use it in the send email action.
fields.summary: Add organisations field as option in the "to" field for send email action

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when admin edits a rule, the current logic on how projects are loaded into this rule configuration screen could cause a slow interaction in the UI side when there are many projects to be loaded. 

For example:
* As the user type the project name, it takes few seconds before the text gets populated/displayed on the projects field.
* As user tick and untick the check box of the projects, it will take few seconds before the check box displayed as ticked or unticked.

(i) The plugin test was performed for ~500 projects based on [Testing your app on a large DC|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/testing-your-app-with-a-large-data-set/#dimensions-of-a-large-jira-dc]


h3. Suggested Solution
We need to refactor the logic on how projects are loaded into the rule configuration screen.
* And to test this plugin on a bigger size instance (for example, higher number of projects) to imitate enterprise scale instance.
fields.summary: Refactor the logic on how projects are loaded into the rule configuration screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When configuring Jira project automations, setting an insight populated custom field value does not work.
After picking field to set the dropdown for choosing the value does not show any results. This happens on all projects and apparently only for non-admin users.

This happens with
 * Insights add-on 8.4+ or Jira Service Management 4.15+
 * Automation app 7.2.3+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup any version of Jira with Automation for Jira and latest version of Insights plugin installed
 # Define Insight Objects
 # Create an Insight custom field with the Insights custom field type of 'Insight Object/s'
 # Log in as user with Project Admin rights, but without global Jira Admin rights
 # In the Action component of your Automation rule, select your Insight custom field
 # Try to type characters into the value field for Insight Objects

h3. Expected Results
Insight Objects should be pre-populated

h3. Actual Results

 No objects populate even after you start typing


h3. Investigation
Checking the har file for this operation shows that for Jira Administrators the query is formatted something like
{code:java}
https://<Base-URL>/rest/insight/1.0/iql/objects?iql=objectTypeId=250
{code}
while for the non admin it was
{code:java}
https://<Base-URL>/rest/insight/1.0/objecttype/250/objects?query=xx 
{code}
And hence fails with 
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 405 ()
{code}
It looks as if [JIRAAUTOSERVER-34|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JIRAAUTOSERVER-34] has been fixed for Jira Administrators only.

h3. Workaround

* Ask a Jira Administrator to set up the rule

* You might be able to use the [Advanced field editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/advanced-field-editing-993924663.html] method to set the Insight customfield value. (Expand the *More options* panel) (See workaround of  [JIRAAUTOSERVER-34|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JIRAAUTOSERVER-34])
fields.summary: Insight objects not auto-populated in set field value screen in A4J

fields.description:
By default, most features of the "Automation for Jira" are not specific to projects. 

For example: We have Project A and Project B with different Security Levels  - SL1 & SL2.
As admin or user say we have permissions to Security Level of both projects.

Now when we configure the rule for only Project A, we change the scope ofthe rule to "Project A". When we go to "Edit Issue" component and select the field Security Levels, both SL1 & SL2 will be visible even though the scope of rule is Project A.

This could cause confusions when the value of fields in both projects have same name. 

It would be great if we can have the rule display the values of fields as per the scope of the rule.
fields.summary: Display value of fields in Automation for Jira as per "Scope"

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
At the moment, when editing the rule and selecting the project (scope), the user can search based on the project name so the field will suggest a smaller scope of the project to choose from.

In some usecases, project keys are more remembered than full project names. With the limitation that project is not searchable using the project key, the admin has to use Jira's native project search to find the full project name.

h4. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to search projects based on their project key. Project key is often being remembered by the users than the full project name.
fields.summary: Allow project search using project key

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
At the moment, when editing the rule and selecting the project (scope), the projects will be listed following the project ID recorded in the database.

h4. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the projects listed using alphabetical order, as this order is more meaningful to users, instead of project ID.
fields.summary: Project listed to follow alphabetical order instead of project ID

fields.description:
{quote}As an automation rule writer,

I want a glossary/dictionary of the available smart values

So that I am more effective at writing rules to solve my team's business needs.
{quote}
Acceptance Criteria:
 * One page containing all available smart values for automation for Jira
 * Consider using a wiki-format drill down (allowing rapid reading/scanning/searching, and then exploration of details).  For an example, please see your REST API documentation.
 * Each entry notes usage scope by product: Jira Cloud, Server/Data Center, JSD, etc.
 * Each entry notes version history for changes in behavior
 * Each entry lists/links to the child attributes (e.g. {{issue.resolution}} contains id, name, etc.
 * Add a link to this help within the automation rule editor
 * The documentation page shows the last updated date/time
 * Bonus: each entry contains example usage
 * Bonus: this page is dynamically updated by code releases, so it is always up to date
 * Bonus: when certain attributes are not available, work-arounds are suggested, such as calling the REST API using a web request to get at the data

Business Case:

 

If you regularly check community automation questions, you will find many are basic needs to learn the available smart values and their attributes. Although the REST API can reveal some of this information, it does not contain all of it.  Please consider developing a complete glossary/dictionary of the available smart values for each product in the Atlassian ecosystem, and make it automatically updated from the source code of releases of automation and the REST API.  Such a glossary/dictionary will save customers a large amount of time, and no doubt reduce the number of contacts to Atlassian support.

Thanks for your work to improve Jira!
fields.summary: create a smart value glossary

fields.description:
Hello, currently there are no way to insert a image inside a email with automation for Jira.

The only way is to add a secure link to the current image from Jira but it requires a account. Unfortunaly it's impossible for external user to access.

 

Here a discussion from 2019 about it :

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-Integrations/How-do-I-add-attachments-to-an-e-mail-with-Automation-for-JIRA/qaq-p/6556]

 

Thanks you
fields.summary: Ability to transfert ticket attachement image file to mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changes done to the ticket are not reflected in the index - JQL query. 

For example: There is a Select List (single choice) custom field “xyz”. When there are changes to it, they are reflected in the issue details screen but not in the JQL query result.

The problem cannot be reproduced every time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Transition an issue within the project which uses A4J and updates a Select List (single choice)  field with a new value.
 # Search issue against the custom field.
{code} key =xyz-1234 and cf[10000] is not empty {code}

 
h3. Expected Results

The value and the details screen and in the JQL search are the same every time.
h3. Actual Results

The value on the details screen is correct. The JQL search shows the wrong value. 
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When changing custom field while transitioning a ticket wrong value is put to the index

fields.description:
In my company we have A LOT of automation rules (100+) and sometimes these are configured to several or all Jira projects. When something happens on a ticket I might have a hard time knowing which of all the rules that made the change on the ticket.

I can of course go through all the audit logs on each and every automation rule but an easy fix would be to add to the Jira ticket history which automation rule that made the change. This would very much help when we need to debug something.
fields.summary: Rule Name/ID in history log for Jira ticket

fields.description:
A4J does not support secret storage. The obvious use case for storing a secret would be for outgoing webhooks, where someone might require an API token in the custom request headers. [https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-2230] solves a specific case of this for first-party clients, but does not explicitly require the implementation of secret storage, so this ticket has been created instead.

An ideal outcome would be a way for users to securely add and remove secrets per automation rule or project, similar to Bitbucket Pipelines variables (which are encrypted at rest), which can then be referenced from within automation rules
fields.summary: Add support for secret storage

fields.description:
It would be great to have more *"Check to perform"* options on *User condition*, such as the below examples:

- is/is not in user field - list of issue fields "User Picker (single user)"
- is/is not in multi-user field - list of issue fields "User Picker (multiple user)"

- is/is not in group from field - list of issue fields "Group Picker (single group)"
- is/is not in any group from field - list of issue fields "Group Picker (multiple group)"
- is in all groups from field - list of issue fields "Group Picker (multiple group)"

Ideally this should work not only with standard Jira fields but also provided by addons with the same type (e.g *Secure fields*).
fields.summary: Support of additional user conditions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some customers are looking for a way to sync comments between a ticket and tickets linked to it. For example, if a comment is edited or deleted in a parent ticket, the same comment should be edited or deleted in the linked tickets.

Unfortunately, there is currently:
- no edited/deleted comment trigger, as per the feature request https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JIRAAUTOSERVER-127
- there is no action that allows to edit or delete a comment (as per this feature request)

h3. Suggested Solution

Add to Automation for Jira an "Edit Comment" action and a "Delete Comment" action.
fields.summary: Implement "Edit Comment" and "Delete Comment" actions in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
Ability to send email to all users in an organization

Currently, it's not possible to send email option works to notify the entire organization so it'd be good to have.
fields.summary: Ability to send email to all users in an organization
Allow users to specify certain parameters while using the Edit issue action

fields.description:
Currently the only bulk export function exports every single rule, so that when you go to import to your dev instance for example, you then need to go in and filter through and tick all the ones you actually want.

 
 # It would be nice if we could get more export functions where we could get a tickbox to select all the ones we want to export. Or export all rules with a certain label.
 # Persist owner and actor on import
 # Additional bulk change functions where we can modify the projects the rule is allocated to with more ease than the current set up. 

This afternoon I've had to move 23 rules from our test instance to our production instance and it's a lot more time consuming than it needs to be.
fields.summary: Allow granular bulk export and bulk changes to automation rules beyond transfer user

fields.description:
Currently, Automation for Jira is lacking the functionality to reorder the labels alphabetically. New labels are created on the bottom of the list, and not where they should be created. Allowing the reordering of the labels would assist in finding the correct labels faster.

Also, the label panel doesn't expand to show the full name of the label. Labels with longer names are trimmed.
fields.summary: Improvements for the labels panel

fields.description: Have the possibility to generate random strings for GUIDs when making an API call. - http://guid.one/guid/make
fields.summary: Generate random strings for GUIDs.

fields.description: Allow setting the importance/priority for emails sent through "Send email" action
fields.summary: Allow automation rule action 'Send email' to set email priority
Smart Values - issue.issuelinks

fields.description: when a rule is deleted, A4J could send a notification to Jira-admins that a rule was deleted, or, in the audit log, we could store for more than 30 days entries that are from a rule deletion.
fields.summary: send a notification or stored a log for mor than 30 days when a rule is deleted
JQL search for SLAs is not working as expected when both are running() simultaneously

fields.description:
We use webhook in Jira DC a lot. Now we are considering to adopt Jira cloud and want to have similar webhook functionality in Jira cloud. We have A4J which is little more secure than traditional webhook feature in Jira cloud.

Even though in A4J, one can secure API by adding Authorization header, but that does not fulfil organisation security needs..

We are looking for MATLS feature which is to ensure connection are trusted from Jira Cloud to on-premise CI systems and vice-versa.

We use webhook to trigger CI pipeline if any configured events occurs.
fields.summary: Secure 'send web request' action with MATLS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using automation rule to add participants, notification emails are not sent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new JSM project
 # Create an automation rule to add a request participant. e.g when description is changed. check the box "This rule should send emails"
 !Automationrule.png|width=846,height=581!
 # Trigger the automation rule

h3. Expected Results

Email notification is sent when request participant is added

h3. Actual Results

No email is sent to the request participant. Even when the email checkbox is checked

h3. Workaround
Use the automation rule to send an email instead
fields.summary: Automation actions do not trigger email notifications when adding issue participants

fields.description:
Currently A4J does not support webhook integration, such as with Opsgenie webhooks.

We would like the ability to integrate webhooks with A4J.
fields.summary: Webhook Integration
Using Jira Automation Addon to copy dates is off by 1d
Include "Change log" in the webhook request ("Send web request" action)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the smart value {{{{defaultValue}}}} there is no value returned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of types: _Select List (single choice)_ or _Text (Single line)_.
# Set a default value for the field.
# Create a rule. (e.g. Edit Issue).
# Use the smart value {{{{issue.customfield_#####.defaultValue}}}}.

h3. Expected Results

It is expected that the default value set for the field is returned by the smart value.


h3. Actual Results

No values are returned (null).

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Smart value defaultValue is not returning results

fields.description:
Provide smart values for $Request Details as it is in Jira service Management Automation.
This will help to get the complete information and use to via Automation for Jira
fields.summary: Provide smart values for $Request Details as it is in Jira service Management Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * If the Edit Issue action is tasked to set values for 2 fields (for example, Story points and Active Sprint), the audit log doesn’t show an error message when one field succeeds and one field fails.
 * If the Edit Issue action is just set to the field that fails, then the error message appears in audit log.

The logging seems to override the error message when there is one field that was successfully edited for the Edit Issue action.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Copy the steps from JIRAAUTOSERVER-276 to trigger the error “No fields or field values to edit for issues (could be due to some field values not existing in a given project)”
 Replicate Board scenario:
 1. BoardA filter is ProjectA only. BoardB has its filter set to Project and ProjectB.
 2. Create a SprintA in BoardA, and create an issue in it (issueA for example).
 3. Open BoardB then start the SprintA from BoardB.

Automation rule:
 1. Create an automation rule (global or project specific) with manual trigger
 2. Choose Edit Issue action, and select the fields Sprint and Story Points.
 3. Choose the Active Sprint (BoardB) for the set value of the Sprint field.
 4. Set the Story Points value to a number.
 5. Publish changes.
 6. Navigate to any issue (that isn’t included in SprintA) then trigger the rule.

h3. Expected Results
Specifically on automation rule logging
Audit log should show the error message “No fields or field values to edit for issues (could be due to some field values not existing in a given project)”

h3. Actual Results
Specifically on automation rule logging:
The audit log shows the automation run as successful even though the Sprint field was not updated.

 !image-2021-07-22-15-55-17-551.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Separate fields into individual Edit Issue actions instead of combining into one Edit Issue action.
fields.summary: When there are two fields being edited on the Edit Issue action, the audit log doesn't mention the errored field if the other field is successfully updated
A4J cannot set Select List (multiple choices)

fields.description:
h3. Issue
We do not currently support accessing fields within insight objects. Only the following are supported as the moment as per [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/smart-values-993924860.html#Smartvalues-insightfieldsInsightfields].

You can access an insight field's full name, key, or summary through the following smart values:
{{issue.InsightField}}          // returns Some Client Name (ABC-123)
{{issue.InsightField.key}}      // returns ABC-123
{{issue.InsightField.summary}}  // returns Some Client Name

h3. Suggestion
Allow accessing all object attributes via smart values like
{{issue.InsightField.User}}          // returns the value in the User attribute of the object
fields.summary: Support access of all Insight attributes through smart values

fields.description:
In the cloud version of A4J, we have the option to run rules with the generic "Automation for Jira" user managed by Automation for Jira as it is mentioned on the [What is a rule actor?|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/what-is-a-rule-actor/].

In the On-Premisses version of the app (Server and Data Center), while it is recommended to use a dedicated user as the actor, it is required for this user to be manually created, and this user will count towards the license limit.
 *Reference:* [Concepts - Rule Actors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/concepts-993924598.html#Concepts-Ruleactors]

We'd like for the option available on Cloud to be imported into the On-Premisses version to avoid having the user counting towards the license limit.
fields.summary: Have the option to run rules with a "system" user

fields.description:
It would be very useful for readability, and in-line documentation purposes, if we could add annotations to items in automation steps.

 

For example, I'd like to be able to add some plain-english text next to a step to explain what we're doing - such as "if the outcome is X, do this _____" etc

It would make it easier to read other people's automations, and document and remember our own.

 

Currently, we have to step through an entire automation to be clear of what it is doing.

 

See screenshot for example

 

!image-2021-07-08-13-47-56-140.png!
fields.summary: Add annotation to steps in an automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the "Field value changed" for triggering automation rule when *Archived* or *Archiver* fields are changed, the Archive issue action is not being considered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new automation rule
# Set *Archived* and *Archiver* fields as values to monitor using the "Field value changed" Trigger
# Set some action
# Archive an issue

h3. Expected Results
Automation rule trigger the action

h3. Actual Results
The automation rule is not being triggered

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Field value changed" not considering Archived and Archiver fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Automation does not allow Trigger rules when a Jira issue is being archived. It would be great if a rule could be triggered when archiving issues.

h3. Workaround

The only workaround right now is to manually perform the actions.
fields.summary: Trigger for Issue archive action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Conditions module, Automation for Jira validates using hard coded field names. This causes issues if Jira is installed in German language. As field names to compare are 'hard coded' in English, A4J fails to compare fields if the name of the field is different in German language.

(i) This behaviour is observed only when Jira is installed in ‘German’ language. If we install Jira in English and change the profile/default language to ‘German’, this issue is not observed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira in German Language.
 # Install 'Automation for Jira' plugin.
 # Configure a rule where "Epic Link" is involved. System field “Epic Link” is called “Epos-Verknüpfung” in German language.
 !Screenshot 2021-07-07 at 8.04.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Trigger the rule.

h3. Expected Results
Rule should execute successfully as "Epic Exists" will return "true".

h3. Actual Results
Rule fails with "No actions performed" as "Epic Exists" will return 'false' even though 'Epic link' is present for the "trigger rule".

(*) Looks like A4J is looking for “Epic Link” as hardcoded value due to which “Epos-Verknüpfung” value is ignored in "Condition" component of the rule. 


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Conditions for some fields does not work in Automation for Jira if Jira is installed in the German language

fields.description:
Customers would like to be able of using the same JIRA Notification template for messages sent by "Send Email" action in Automation for JIRA.

Currently A4J only provides support for basic HTML and doesn't allow us to natively import CSS configuration files from JIRA Notification templates, which might come in handy for this use case in the future.
fields.summary: Allow A4J to mimic JIRA Notification template when using "Send Email" action

fields.description:
An Automation rule's scope can currently be set to either:
* Single Project
* Global
* Multiple Projects

However, when a customer automation rules for a large volume of projects that need to be administered, excluding specific projects from a global rule is not ideal especially when there are 500 projects and only a handful needs to be excluded.

Suggestion:
Add an exclude option when choosing the Multiple Projects scope for an Automation Rule.
fields.summary: Exclude Projects in Automation for Jira Rule Scope

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Automation for Jira plugin allows for an Assign Issue action. One of the options for assigning an issue is *Another field value or comment*, which further allows the action to assign the issue to the *Previous Assignee*, who is specifically the user who was the previous assignee before the current one.

This functionality works as long as there was an assignee prior the current one at the time the rule is executed, but this will not set an issue to *Unassigned* if that were the previous assignee value.

This will instead record the following message in the Audit Log:
{quote}Can not find a valid previous assignee.{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow an additional configuration while setting up the rule action to allow setting the Assignee to Unassigned.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow Assign Issue to Previous Assignee set issue to Unassigned

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Automation for Jira rule trigger *Manual trigger* only alow to authorize the action by group. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to change the permission by user, role, or organization

h3. Why this is important
Simplifies the number of rules, prevents users from creating nearly duplicate rules

h3. Workaround

Add a new *if* condition *User condition* under the trigger, to make sure that only specific users or role/organization members are able to run the rule.
fields.summary: Add user, role or organization to Manual Trigger options

fields.description:
Currently, if you create a rule Label in Automation for Jira, this label will be displayed under all projects *Project Automation* section.

Sometimes, as a Jira Administrator, I would like to configure these Labels on a project-specific basis.
fields.summary: Allow Labels to be used in a project-specific basis

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you accidentally create or decide to retire a rule label, there is no option to remove it through the UI.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule label.
 # Remove all the rules from that label.

h3. Expected Results
* The label will be marked as *unused* and an option for its removal will appear.

h3. Actual Results
* The label is marked as *unused* but there is no way to remove it.

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unused Labels can not be deleted in Automation for Jira
Editing Date Time field timezone using Additional Fields doesn't return the correct timezone

fields.description:
Issue link deleted rule should be succeed when the rule can work after the issue is deleted.


h3. Issue Summary

Issue link deleted rule will be failed when the issue is deleted.
It is expected behavior now, but if the rule can work after the issue is deleted, the rule should be succeeded as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1.Configure the following rule in Automation for Jira
 !a4j-rule-issue_link_deleted.png|thumbnail! 
2.Link the source issue(issue A) to destination issue(issue B). issue A => issue B 
 !jira-source-issue_issueA.png|thumbnail! 
 !jira-destination-issue_issueB.png|thumbnail! 
3.Delete issue B
4.Automation rule will be failed in spite of the rule will comment on the source issue(issue A).
The source issue(issue A) still exists, and the rule can comment on the source issue(issue A).
 !a4j-audit-log-some-errors.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results

- Issue link deleted rule will be failed when the issue is deleted.

h3. Expected Results

- Issue link deleted rule will be succeeded when the rule could work after the issue is deleted.


h3. Workaround

- Use change status(transition) or archive instead of deleting an issue.

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue link deleted rule should be succeed when the rule can work after the issue is deleted.

fields.description:
Currently, there is an article in the Cloud version of Automation for Jira that outlines how the application handles different situations associated with the *Rule Actor*.

[Run Rules as another user|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/run-rules-as-another-user/]

However, the features available in the Server/Data Center version of Automation for Jira are different from the ones available in Cloud, which leads to confusion amongst the users.

It would be nice to include a documentation article that would determine the expected behavior of the application under the same situations.
fields.summary: Documentation article - Run Rules as another user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to limit or filter the results of a smart value on Automation for Jira - Datacenter version.
As an example, listing linked issues in an automation email can be done using Smart Values \{\{\{{issue.issuelinks.inwardIssue.key}}}} or \{\{\{{issue.issuelinks.outwardIssue.key}}}}. 

However, there is no current way to retrieve only the tickets linked with "is blocked by".


h3. Suggested Solution

Reducing a list using filters
https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1241

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Ability to filter a list in smart-values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to create a CRON expression to start at the second 00 and run every 10 minutes (using the *SCHEDULED* trigger), A4J seems to ignore the first 0 in the expression and starts at a different second than 0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Create a rule and set the trigger to *SCHEDULED* by the below CRON expression
 # Add a CRON expression that should start in 0 seconds

h3. Expected Results
* e.g CRON to run every 10 minutes, starting from the 0 seconds (0 0/10 * * * ? *)
- 8:00:00 pm
- 8:10:00 pm
- 8:20:00 pm

h3. Actual Results
* Automation seems to ignore the first 0 in the expression
- 8:00:51 pm
- 8:10:51 pm
- 8:20:51 pm
fields.summary: CRON expression to consider seconds on Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When \{{now.withDayOfWeek("")}} is used in A4J rules, it returns nothing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to create a ticket in a project or an automation rule with a trigger *Issue commented.*
 # In the *Create issue* event, include \{{now.withDayOfWeek("")}} in the summary or a Log action with Log message - Week :\{{now.dayOfWeek("")}}.
 # Execute the rule and check the week number in the issue summary.

h3. Expected Results

{\{now.withDayOfWeek("")}} should return the correct date.
h3. Actual Results

{\{now.withDayOfWeek("")}} returns nothing.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Support {{now.withDayOfWeek("")}} Function

fields.description:
Currently "Issue Fields Condition" would search for value of the field. If we change the value of the field, then we need to change the entire rule.

For Example let's take "Issue Fields Condition" that checks the 'value' of Customer Request Type. However, as this condition checks the value of name of "Customer Request Type" (as 'string') rather than the DB value, we need to make changes to the rule everytime we change the value of 'Customer Request Type'.

* If the Customer Request type is set to "Test" and rule is configured using "Issue Fields Condition" to check the value and proceed.
* However, if we change the name of Customer Request type to 'Test1', then the rule would not execute as the "Issue Fields Condition" would still be looking for 'Test'. 
* If the "Issue Fields Condition" is configured to look for ID or other unique value of field (Customer Request Type), then even if field is renamed, the rule will work as it will be looking for the ID to compare.
fields.summary: "Issue Fields Condition" should search for field ID instead of field value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring two rules: one to link an issue and the other one to act on "issue linked" event, we noticed that using "Issue linked match" condition confuses the source and destination of the issue link if the issue link has "Inward Description" same as "Outward Description" (e.g 'relates to' that works in both ways).

For example, linking issue1 to issue2 using the 'relates to' link in an A4J rule will end up in:
 * issue1 *relates to* issue2
AND
 * issue2 *relates to* issue1

However, running the "Issue linked match" in the second rule will run the check on issue2 instead of issue1.

PS: This issue is not reproducible when:
 * Using a different issue link that has "Inward Description" different than "Outward Description" (e.g blocks)
 * Linking the issues manually to trigger the second rule.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two rules as follows and enable the second rule to be triggered by other rules:
+Rule 1:+
 ** When "Issue Created"
 ** Then "Link the issue to TSP-7 using the 'relates to' link"
!Screenshot 2021-06-08 at 14.38.30.png|width=327,height=173!
+Rule 2:+
 ** When "Issue Linked"
 ** If "'some linked issues' using 'relates to' link match: JQL 'issuekey=TSP-7'"
 ** Then "Add a comment 'Link verified' to the current issue"
!Screenshot 2021-06-08 at 14.40.48.png|width=300,height=171! 
!Screenshot 2021-06-08 at 14.40.56.png|width=275,height=149!
 # Create an issue in the test project. (in the example TSP-34)

h3. Expected Results

The second rule should add a comment "Link verified" to the created (TSP-34) issue since it was linked by 'relates to' to 'TSP-7' by the first rule.

Here is the result of the execution of the first rule:

!Screenshot 2021-06-08 at 15.01.45.png|width=401,height=137!
h3. Actual Results

Here we can see that Rule 2 ran successfully but doesn't add a comment and throws "The following issues did not match the condition: TSP-7".

!Screenshot 2021-06-08 at 15.03.00.png|width=872,height=133!

The rule uses TSP-7 as Source issue and TSP-34 as Destination issue. It should be the opposite or at least the rule should run for both issues.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can edit the Issue Link configuration (under {_}Administration > Issues > Issue linking{_}) and make sure to use an "Inward Description" different than the "Outward Description".
In this example, we have changed "relates to" to "is related to" for the Inward Description:
!IssueLinkingDiff.png|width=361,height=154!

P.S: After editing the issue link then reverting it back to the original configuration ("Inward Description"="Outward Description"), the issue is no more reproducible.
h3. Note

There are some cases where we noticed a weird behavior of the 'relates to' issue link when used in an A4J automation rule. The rule may stop or resume working suddenly after modifying that issue link (e.g one of the descriptions). It is recommended to avoid using the 'relates to' issue link in this case until this BUG is further investigated.
fields.summary: "Issue linked match" condition confuses source and destination of the issue link when the link is created by an automation rule and has "Inward Description" the same as "Outward Description"

fields.description: Sorting A4J rules based on creation date or updated date might help some customers that needs to review rules periodically.
fields.summary: Ability of sorting A4J rules based on date of rule creation or date of rule being updated.

fields.description:
At the moment the trigger *Field Value changed* in A4J does not support Insight Custom fields.

Please provide support for Insight custom fields in Field Value changed trigger in a rule.
fields.summary: Field value changed trigger should support insight fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Process all issues produced by this trigger in bulk" feature allows issues triggered by a rule to be combined together for an action such as send email.

In the current state, it will combine all issues when triggering the action, which includes fields that may be needed when specifying the email recipient. 

For example, when specifying a field such as "reporter" or "assignee" as the email recipient, a single email will be sent with a combine ALL recipient from the issues triggering the action.
h4. Suggested solution

Allow an option to split each email on a per recipient basis.

For example, if we have 3 issues triggered:
 * Issue 1 - Assignee - "User1"
 * Issue 2 - Assigne - "User 1"
 * Issue 3 - Assignee - "User 2"

Then the action would generate 2 emails -
 * Email 1 - Issue 1, Issue 2, Sent to "User 1"
 * Email 2 - Issue 3, Sent to "User 2"
fields.summary: Improve "Process all issues produced by this trigger in bulk" to split emails based on recipient

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Send email action sends email to inactive user if "To" include {{issue.watchers.emailAddress}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Automation rule
 # Set {{issue.watchers.emailAddress}} to "To"

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-03 at 9.27.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Inactive user excluded from the email

h3. Actual Results
Email send all users include inactive user

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to exclude inactive users from issue.watchers.emailAddress

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The smart value {{issue.toUrl}} can be used to provide a link to an issue in question in A4J automation rules. It is expected that it use Jira's Base URL as this is the link that users will be clicking to access the issue.

There are uncommon and unpredictable situations where the smart value will instead using the hostname of one of the nodes, rather than the Base URL. This is generally not reproducible at will, as attempting to forcibly repeat the situation tends to correctly use the Base URL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unknown - use {{issue.toUrl}} in an Automation Rule in some form of communication (comment, email, etc)

h3. Expected Results
{{issue.toUrl}} should always use the Base URL of Jira

h3. Actual Results
{{issue.toUrl}} sometimes will use the hostname of a node

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In a DC Cluster, issue.toUrl sometimes uses hostname of node rather than Base URL
